page.title: 16HARTLEBURY GRAIN STORE
page.content:
One of the results of Britain's accession to the{European Economic {Community}was that farmers were guaranteed a minimum price for much of their produce. One item covered by this guarantee is grain of all types.
This minimum price is known as the {intervention price}and if the open market price drops below this figure Government-run bodies step in and buy the surplus grain at the guaranteed price. The agency then stores the grain until the price goes up again or it is otherwise disposed of.
One of these stores is on{Hartlebury {Trading Estate,}in Square Three of the block.
